data.text: Every friend saith, I am his friend also:
Is it not a grief unto death,
O wicked imagination, whence camest thou in
There is a companion, which rejoiceth in the prosperity of a friend,
There is a companion, which helpeth his friend for the belly,
Forget not thy friend in thy mind,
Every counselor extolleth counsel;
Beware of a counselor,
And say unto thee, Thy way is good:
Consult not with one that suspecteth thee:
Neither consult with a woman touching her of whom she is jealous;
But be continually with a godly man,
And let the counsel of thine own heart stand:
For a manâ€™s mind is sometime wont to tell him more
And above all this pray to the most High,
Let reason go before every enterprize,
The countenance is a sign of changing of the heart.
Four manners of things appear: good and evil, life and death:
There is one that is wise and teacheth many,
There is one that showeth wisdom in words, and is hated:
For grace is not given him from the Lord;
Another is wise to himself;
A wise man instructeth his people;
A wise man shall be filled with blessing;
The days of the life of man may be numbered;
A wise man shall inherit glory among his people,
My son, prove thy soul in thy life,
For all things are not profitable for all men,
Be not insatiable in any dainty thing,
For excess of meats bringeth sickness,
By surfeiting have many perished;
